name: Anafenza, Kin-Tree Spirit
oracle_text: Whenever another nontoken creature enters the battlefield under your control, bolster 1. (Choose a creature with the least toughness among creatures you control and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
flavor_text: The Machine Legion coveted her strength, but a spirit of sand, sun, and memory could never be *compleated*.
title: Anafenza, Kin-Tree Spirit

name: Daxos, Blessed by the Sun
oracle_text:
Daxos's toughness is equal to your devotion to white. (Each {W} in the mana costs of permanents you control counts toward your devotion to white.)
Whenever another creature you control enters the battlefield or dies, you gain 1 life.
title: Daxos, Blessed by the Sun

name: Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite
oracle_text:
Vigilance
Other creatures you control get +2/+2.
Creatures your opponents control get -2/-2.
flavor_text: "Rejoice, blessed evangels! The glorious light of *compleation* is nigh. Soon, we shall awaken the Multiverse from its slumber."
title: Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite

name: Kenrith, the Returned King
oracle_text:
{R}: All creatures gain trample and haste until end of turn.
{1}{G}: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
{2}{W}: Target player gains 5 life.
{3}{U}: Target player draws a card.
{4}{B}: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under its owner's control.
title: Kenrith, the Returned King

name: Kwende, Pride of Femeref
oracle_text:
Double strike
Creatures you control with first strike have double strike.
flavor_text:
"His blades were the ultimate agents of transformation. All Phyrexians who met them were transformed into pieces."
—*Heroes of the Second Invasion*
title: Kwende, Pride of Femeref

name: Sram, Senior Edificer
oracle_text: Whenever you cast an Aura, Equipment, or Vehicle spell, draw a card.
flavor_text:
"Always have the right tool for the job, especially if the job is blasting Phyrexians in the face."
—Monument inscription
title: Sram, Senior Edificer

name: Thalia, Guardian of Thraben
oracle_text:
First strike
Noncreature spells cost {1} more to cast.
flavor_text: No stranger to monstrous foes, Thalia marshaled surviving cathars, townspeople, and even ghoulcallers into an unbreakable fighting force.
title: Thalia, Guardian of Thraben

name: Baral, Chief of Compliance
oracle_text:
Instant and sorcery spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
Whenever a spell or ability you control counters a spell, you may draw a card. If you do, discard a card.
flavor_text: In light of his zealous defense of Kaladesh, the Consulate was willing to overlook any previous transgressions.
title: Baral, Chief of Compliance

name: Emry, Lurker of the Loch
oracle_text:
This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.
When Emry, Lurker of the Loch enters the battlefield, mill four cards.
{T}: Choose target artifact card in your graveyard. You may cast that card this turn. (You still pay its costs. Timing rules still apply.)
title: Emry, Lurker of the Loch

name: Inga Rune-Eyes
oracle_text:
When Inga Rune-Eyes enters the battlefield, scry 3.
When Inga Rune-Eyes dies, draw three cards if three or more creatures died this turn.
flavor_text: Her fleet bore countless survivors to safety, slipping swiftly through strange currents no Phyrexian could track.
title: Inga Rune-Eyes

name: Jin-Gitaxias, Core Augur
oracle_text:
Flash
At the beginning of your end step, draw seven cards.
Each opponent's maximum hand size is reduced by seven.
flavor_text: His knowledge of the Multiverse enabled New Phyrexia to strike each plane with surgical precision.
title: Jin-Gitaxias, Core Augur

name: Tetsuko Umezawa, Fugitive
oracle_text: Creatures you control with power or toughness 1 or less can't be blocked.
flavor_text:
"Her talent for slipping unseen behind enemy lines provided information that would prove crucial to Dominaria's defense."
—*Heroes of the Second Invasion*
title: Tetsuko Umezawa, Fugitive

name: Ayara, First of Locthwain
oracle_text:
Whenever Ayara, First of Locthwain or another black creature enters the battlefield under your control, each opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
{T}, Sacrifice another black creature: Draw a card.
title: Ayara, First of Locthwain

name: Horobi, Death's Wail
oracle_text:
Flying
Whenever a creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, destroy that creature.
flavor_text:
"Wherever it went, death came to Phyrexians and Kamigawans alike."
—Records of the Living Historians
title: Horobi, Death's Wail

name: Seizan, Perverter of Truth
oracle_text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player loses 2 life and draws two cards.
flavor_text:
"In its hatred for the mortal realms, it fought on the side of the invaders, heedless of its own eventual fate."
—Records of the Living Historians
title: Seizan, Perverter of Truth

name: Sheoldred, Whispering One
oracle_text:
Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, that player sacrifices a creature.
title: Sheoldred, Whispering One

name: Skithiryx, the Blight Dragon
oracle_text:
Flying
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
{B}: Skithiryx, the Blight Dragon gains haste until end of turn.
{B}{B}: Regenerate Skithiryx.
title: Skithiryx, the Blight Dragon

name: Tymaret, Chosen from Death
oracle_text:
Tymaret's toughness is equal to your devotion to black. (Each {B} in the mana costs of permanents you control counts toward your devotion to black.)
{1}{B}: Exile up to two target cards from graveyards. You gain 1 life for each creature card exiled this way.
title: Tymaret, Chosen from Death

name: Yargle, Glutton of Urborg
flavor_text: Consuming even a single drop of the oil would spell doom for most living things. But Yargle was not most living things, and he ate enough to clean up most of Urborg.
title: Yargle, Glutton of Urborg

name: Captain Lannery Storm
oracle_text:
Haste
Whenever Captain Lannery Storm attacks, create a Treasure token. (It's an artifact with "{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color.")
Whenever you sacrifice a Treasure, Captain Lannery Storm gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
title: Captain Lannery Storm

name: Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer
oracle_text:
Whenever Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer deals combat damage to a player, create a Treasure token and exile the top card of that player's library. Until end of turn, you may cast that card.
Dash {1}{R} (You may cast this spell for its dash cost. If you do, it gains haste, and it's returned from the battlefield to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step.)
title: Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer

name: Squee, the Immortal
oracle_text: You may cast Squee, the Immortal from your graveyard or from exile.
flavor_text:
Squee had never wanted to be a king or a symbol of defiance against Phyrexians. Naturally, he found himself as both.
—*Heroes of the Second Invasion*
title: Squee, the Immortal

name: Urabrask the Hidden
oracle_text:
Creatures you control have haste.
Creatures your opponents control enter the battlefield tapped.
flavor_text: While the other praetors eagerly prepared for invasion, Urabrask retreated to the Furnace Layer, defying Elesh Norn's commands.
title: Urabrask the Hidden

name: Valduk, Keeper of the Flame
oracle_text: At the beginning of combat on your turn, for each Aura and Equipment attached to Valduk, Keeper of the Flame, create a 3/1 red Elemental creature token with trample and haste. Exile those tokens at the beginning of the next end step.
title: Valduk, Keeper of the Flame

name: Zada, Hedron Grinder
oracle_text: Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell that targets only Zada, Hedron Grinder, copy that spell for each other creature you control that the spell could target. Each copy targets a different one of those creatures.
flavor_text: To her delight, she was able to fully realize the explosive magical potential of hedrons.
title: Zada, Hedron Grinder

name: Fynn, the Fangbearer
oracle_text:
Deathtouch
Whenever a creature you control with deathtouch deals combat damage to a player, that player gets two poison counters. (A player with ten or more poison counters loses the game.)
flavor_text: "I always said I had a score to settle with that serpent. I'm a man of my word."
title: Fynn, the Fangbearer

name: Goreclaw, Terror of Qal Sisma
oracle_text:
Creature spells you cast with power 4 or greater cost {2} less to cast.
Whenever Goreclaw, Terror of Qal Sisma attacks, each creature you control with power 4 or greater gets +1/+1 and gains trample until end of turn.
title: Goreclaw, Terror of Qal Sisma

name: Renata, Called to the Hunt
oracle_text:
Renata's power is equal to your devotion to green. (Each {G} in the mana costs of permanents you control counts toward your devotion to green.)
Each other creature you control enters the battlefield with an additional +1/+1 counter on it.
title: Renata, Called to the Hunt

name: Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger
oracle_text:
Trample
Whenever you tap a land for mana, add one mana of any type that land produced.
Whenever an opponent taps a land for mana, that land doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
title: Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger

name: Yedora, Grave Gardener
oracle_text: Whenever another nontoken creature you control dies, you may return it to the battlefield face down under its owner's control. It's a Forest land. (It has no other types or abilities.)
flavor_text: She whispered ancient rites over the fallen, bidding their essences return to the land before they could be repurposed by the machines.
title: Yedora, Grave Gardener

name: Aegar, the Freezing Flame
oracle_text: Whenever a creature or planeswalker an opponent controls is dealt excess damage, if a Giant, Wizard, or spell you controlled dealt damage to it this turn, draw a card.
flavor_text: Though Phyrexian machines could adapt to extremes of heat or cold, they never figured out how to adapt to both at once.
title: Aegar, the Freezing Flame

name: Arixmethes, Slumbering Isle
oracle_text:
Arixmethes, Slumbering Isle enters the battlefield tapped with five slumber counters on it.
As long as Arixmethes has a slumber counter on it, it's a land. (It's not a creature.)
Whenever you cast a spell, you may remove a slumber counter from Arixmethes.
{T}: Add {G}{U}.
title: Arixmethes, Slumbering Isle

name: Atraxa, Praetors' Voice
oracle_text:
Flying, vigilance, deathtouch, lifelink
At the beginning of your end step, proliferate. (Choose any number of permanents and/or players, then give each another counter of each kind already there.)
flavor_text:
"Teach these people to pay the price of their insolence."
—Elesh Norn
title: Atraxa, Praetors' Voice

name: Atris, Oracle of Half-Truths
oracle_text:
Menace
When Atris, Oracle of Half-Truths enters the battlefield, target opponent looks at the top three cards of your library and separates them into a face-down pile and a face-up pile. Put one pile into your hand and the other into your graveyard.
title: Atris, Oracle of Half-Truths

name: Aurelia, the Warleader
oracle_text:
Flying, vigilance, haste
Whenever Aurelia, the Warleader attacks for the first time each turn, untap all creatures you control. After this phase, there is an additional combat phase.
flavor_text: Leading from behind had never been her style.
title: Aurelia, the Warleader

name: Brudiclad, Telchor Engineer
oracle_text:
Creature tokens you control have haste.
At the beginning of combat on your turn, create a 2/1 blue Phyrexian Myr artifact creature token. Then you may choose a token you control. If you do, each other token you control becomes a copy of that token.
title: Brudiclad, Telchor Engineer

name: Dina, Soul Steeper
oracle_text:
Whenever you gain life, each opponent loses 1 life.
{1}, Sacrifice another creature: Dina, Soul Steeper gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is the sacrificed creature's power.
flavor_text: Her concoctions corroded metal and fortified organic tissue. They would be studied for generations.
title: Dina, Soul Steeper

name: Ezuri, Claw of Progress
oracle_text:
Whenever a creature with power 2 or less enters the battlefield under your control, you get an experience counter.
At the beginning of combat on your turn, put X +1/+1 counters on another target creature you control, where X is the number of experience counters you have.
title: Ezuri, Claw of Progress

name: Firesong and Sunspeaker
oracle_text:
Red instant and sorcery spells you control have lifelink.
Whenever a white instant or sorcery spell causes you to gain life, Firesong and Sunspeaker deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
title: Firesong and Sunspeaker

name: Firja, Judge of Valor
oracle_text:
Flying, lifelink
Whenever you cast your second spell each turn, look at the top three cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.
flavor_text: Invader after invader fell before her, and to each she spoke a single word: "Unworthy."
title: Firja, Judge of Valor

name: Grimgrin, Corpse-Born
oracle_text:
Grimgrin, Corpse-Born enters the battlefield tapped and doesn't untap during your untap step.
Sacrifice another creature: Untap Grimgrin and put a +1/+1 counter on it.
Whenever Grimgrin attacks, destroy target creature defending player controls, then put a +1/+1 counter on Grimgrin.
title: Grimgrin, Corpse-Born

name: Gyruda, Doom of Depths
oracle_text:
Companion — Your starting deck contains only cards with even mana values. (If this card is your chosen companion, you may put it into your hand from outside the game for {3} any time you could cast a sorcery.)
When Gyruda enters the battlefield, each player mills four cards. Put a creature card with an even mana value from among the milled cards onto the battlefield under your control.
title: Gyruda, Doom of Depths

name: Imoti, Celebrant of Bounty
oracle_text:
Cascade (When you cast this spell, exile cards from the top of your library until you exile a nonland card that costs less. You may cast it without paying its mana cost. Put the exiled cards on the bottom of your library in a random order.)
Spells you cast with mana value 6 or greater have cascade.
title: Imoti, Celebrant of Bounty

name: Jegantha, the Wellspring
oracle_text:
Companion — No card in your starting deck has more than one of the same mana symbol in its mana cost. (If this card is your chosen companion, you may put it into your hand from outside the game for {3} any time you could cast a sorcery.)
{T}: Add {W}{U}{B}{R}{G}. This mana can't be spent to pay generic mana costs.
title: Jegantha, the Wellspring

name: Judith, the Scourge Diva
oracle_text:
Other creatures you control get +1/+0.
Whenever a nontoken creature you control dies, Judith, the Scourge Diva deals 1 damage to any target.
flavor_text: She protected Ravnica with the same things that thrilled her fans: courage, charisma, and a grand assortment of spiked chains.
title: Judith, the Scourge Diva

name: Juri, Master of the Revue
oracle_text:
Whenever you sacrifice a permanent, put a +1/+1 counter on Juri, Master of the Revue.
When Juri dies, it deals damage equal to its power to any target.
flavor_text: "Sure, the invasion was violent, but where was the beauty? As an artist, I had to intervene."
title: Juri, Master of the Revue

name: Kaheera, the Orphanguard
oracle_text:
Companion — Each creature card in your starting deck is a Cat, Elemental, Nightmare, Dinosaur, or Beast card. (If this card is your chosen companion, you may put it into your hand from outside the game for {3} any time you could cast a sorcery.)
Vigilance
Each other creature you control that's a Cat, Elemental, Nightmare, Dinosaur, or Beast gets +1/+1 and has vigilance.
title: Kaheera, the Orphanguard

name: Keruga, the Macrosage
oracle_text:
Companion — Your starting deck contains only cards with mana value 3 or greater and land cards. (If this card is your chosen companion, you may put it into your hand from outside the game for {3} any time you could cast a sorcery.)
When Keruga, the Macrosage enters the battlefield, draw a card for each other permanent you control with mana value 3 or greater.
title: Keruga, the Macrosage

name: Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger
oracle_text:
When Kroxa enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless it escaped.
Whenever Kroxa enters the battlefield or attacks, each opponent discards a card, then each opponent who didn't discard a nonland card this way loses 3 life.
Escape—{B}{B}{R}{R}, Exile five other cards from your graveyard. (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its escape cost.)
title: Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger

name: Lathiel, the Bounteous Dawn
oracle_text:
Lifelink
At the beginning of each end step, if you gained life this turn, distribute up to that many +1/+1 counters among any number of other target creatures.
title: Lathiel, the Bounteous Dawn

name: Lurrus of the Dream-Den
oracle_text:
Companion — Each permanent card in your starting deck has mana value 2 or less. (If this card is your chosen companion, you may put it into your hand from outside the game for {3} any time you could cast a sorcery.)
Lifelink
During each of your turns, you may cast one permanent spell with mana value 2 or less from your graveyard.
title: Lurrus of the Dream-Den

name: Lutri, the Spellchaser
oracle_text:
Companion — Each nonland card in your starting deck has a different name. (If this card is your chosen companion, you may put it into your hand from outside the game for {3} any time you could cast a sorcery.)
Flash
When Lutri, the Spellchaser enters the battlefield, if you cast it, copy target instant or sorcery spell you control. You may choose new targets for the copy.
title: Lutri, the Spellchaser

name: Niv-Mizzet Reborn
oracle_text:
Flying
When Niv-Mizzet Reborn enters the battlefield, reveal the top ten cards of your library. For each color pair, choose a card that's exactly those colors from among them. Put the chosen cards into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order.
title: Niv-Mizzet Reborn

name: Obosh, the Preypiercer
oracle_text:
Companion — Your starting deck contains only cards with odd mana values and land cards. (If this card is your chosen companion, you may put it into your hand from outside the game for {3} any time you could cast a sorcery.)
If a source you control with an odd mana value would deal damage to a permanent or player, it deals double that damage to that permanent or player instead.
title: Obosh, the Preypiercer

name: Radha, Coalition Warlord
oracle_text: Domain — Whenever Radha, Coalition Warlord becomes tapped, another target creature you control gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of basic land types among lands you control.
flavor_text:
"Those mindless drones could never have defeated us. We are Keldons."
—Grand Warlord Radha
title: Radha, Coalition Warlord

name: Raff, Weatherlight Stalwart
oracle_text:
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, you may tap two untapped creatures you control. If you do, draw a card.
{3}{W}{W}: Creatures you control get +1/+1 and gain vigilance until end of turn.
title: Raff, Weatherlight Stalwart

name: Reyav, Master Smith
oracle_text: Whenever a creature you control that's enchanted or equipped attacks, that creature gains double strike until end of turn.
flavor_text: His impromptu demonstration of the portable energy shield attachment both saved lives and increased demand for aether-powered multi-tool gauntlets tenfold.
title: Reyav, Master Smith

name: Rona, Sheoldred's Faithful
oracle_text:
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, each opponent loses 1 life.
You may cast Rona, Sheoldred's Faithful from your graveyard by discarding two cards in addition to paying its other costs.
flavor_text: While many fought valiantly to preserve humanity, Rona wished only to strip hers away.
title: Rona, Sheoldred's Faithful

name: Shanna, Sisay's Legacy
oracle_text:
Shanna, Sisay's Legacy can't be the target of abilities your opponents control.
Shanna gets +1/+1 for each creature you control.
flavor_text:
"The *Weatherlight* gave so much. It deserved justice as much as any of us."
—Shanna
title: Shanna, Sisay's Legacy

name: Taigam, Ojutai Master
oracle_text:
Instant, sorcery, and Dragon spells you control can't be countered.
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell from your hand, if Taigam, Ojutai Master attacked this turn, that spell gains rebound. (Exile the spell as it resolves. At the beginning of your next upkeep, you may cast that card from exile without paying its mana cost.)
title: Taigam, Ojutai Master

name: Teysa Karlov
oracle_text:
If a creature dying causes a triggered ability of a permanent you control to trigger, that ability triggers an additional time.
Creature tokens you control have vigilance and lifelink.
flavor_text: Her uncanny predictions of Phyrexian movements saved countless lives, though she never revealed the source of her information.
title: Teysa Karlov

name: Umori, the Collector
oracle_text:
Companion — Each nonland card in your starting deck shares a card type. (If this card is your chosen companion, you may put it into your hand from outside the game for {3} any time you could cast a sorcery.)
As Umori, the Collector enters the battlefield, choose a card type.
Spells you cast of the chosen type cost {1} less to cast.
title: Umori, the Collector

name: Yarok, the Desecrated
oracle_text:
Deathtouch, lifelink
If a permanent entering the battlefield causes a triggered ability of a permanent you control to trigger, that ability triggers an additional time.
flavor_text:
"Its blighted heart, its spinous hands To break the hosts that foul its lands."
—*Triumph of Bala Ged*, stanza 6
title: Yarok, the Desecrated

name: Yorion, Sky Nomad
oracle_text:
Companion — Your starting deck contains at least twenty cards more than the minimum deck size. (If this card is your chosen companion, you may put it into your hand from outside the game for {3} any time you could cast a sorcery.)
Flying
When Yorion enters the battlefield, exile any number of other nonland permanents you own and control. Return those cards to the battlefield at the beginning of the next end step.
title: Yorion, Sky Nomad

name: Zirda, the Dawnwaker
oracle_text:
Companion — Each permanent card in your starting deck has an activated ability. (If this card is your chosen companion, you may put it into your hand from outside the game for {3} any time you could cast a sorcery.)
Abilities you activate that aren't mana abilities cost {2} less to activate. This effect can't reduce the mana in that cost to less than one mana.
{1}, {T}: Target creature can't block this turn.
title: Zirda, the Dawnwaker

name: Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite
oracle_text:
Vigilance
Other creatures you control get +2/+2.
Creatures your opponents control get -2/-2.
flavor_text: "The Gitaxians whisper among themselves of other worlds. If they exist, we must bring Phyrexia's magnificence to them."
title: Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite

name: Kenrith, the Returned King
oracle_text:
{R}: All creatures gain trample and haste until end of turn.
{1}{G}: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
{2}{W}: Target player gains 5 life.
{3}{U}: Target player draws a card.
{4}{B}: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under its owner's control.
title: Kenrith, the Returned King

oracle_text: Whenever you cast an Aura, Equipment, or Vehicle spell, draw a card.
flavor_text: "As this conflict grows, it gets harder to prevent the city from breaking down. How much longer can we keep this machinery balanced?"
title: Sram, Senior Edificer

name: Baral, Chief of Compliance
oracle_text:
Instant and sorcery spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
Whenever a spell or ability you control counters a spell, you may draw a card. If you do, discard a card.
flavor_text: "The echo of silence is music to my ears."
title: Baral, Chief of Compliance

name: Jin-Gitaxias, Core Augur
oracle_text:
Flash
At the beginning of your end step, draw seven cards.
Each opponent's maximum hand size is reduced by seven.
flavor_text: "It is not a goal, but a process—the process of creating the perfect Phyrexia."
title: Jin-Gitaxias, Core Augur

oracle_text:
Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.

Flying
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
{B}: Skithiryx, the Blight Dragon gains haste until end of turn.
{B}{B}: Regenerate Skithiryx.
title: Skithiryx, the Blight Dragon

name: Yargle, Glutton of Urborg
flavor_text: When Belzenlok's lieutenant Yar-Kul grew too ambitious, the Demonlord transformed him into a maggot. The frog that ate the maggot grew and grew, until a ravenous spirit burst from its body.
title: Yargle, Glutton of Urborg

name: Urabrask the Hidden
oracle_text:
Creatures you control have haste.
Creatures your opponents control enter the battlefield tapped.
flavor_text: When the Mirran resistance arrived, the furnace dwellers looked to Urabrask for guidance. His decree stunned the others: "Let them be."
title: Urabrask the Hidden

name: Zada, Hedron Grinder
oracle_text: Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell that targets only Zada, Hedron Grinder, copy that spell for each other creature you control that the spell could target. Each copy targets a different one of those creatures.
flavor_text: "A hedron holds magic for a thousand years—or less, if need be."
title: Zada, Hedron Grinder

Flying, lifelink
Whenever you cast your second spell each turn, look at the top three cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.

Lifelink

Flying

oracle_text:
Deathtouch, lifelink
If a permanent entering the battlefield causes a triggered ability of a permanent you control to trigger, that ability triggers an additional time.
flavor_text:
"Yarok grieves within the waste
Of Bala Ged's corrupted land."
—*Lament for Bala Ged*, stanza 1

name: Yorion, Sky Nomad
oracle_text:
Companion — Your starting deck contains at least twenty cards more than the minimum deck size. (If this card is your chosen companion, you may put it into your hand from outside the game for {3} any time you could cast a sorcery.)
Flying

Companion — Each permanent card in your starting deck has an activated ability. (If this card is your chosen companion, you may put it into your hand from outside the game for {3} any time you could cast a sorcery.)

{1}, {T}: Target creature can't block this turn.

name: Anafenza, Kin-Tree Spirit
oracle_text: Whenever another nontoken creature enters the battlefield under your control, bolster 1. (Choose a creature with the least toughness among creatures you control and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
flavor_text: The Machine Legion coveted her strength, but a spirit of sand, sun, and memory could never be *compleated*.
title: Anafenza, Kin-Tree Spirit

name: Daxos, Blessed by the Sun
oracle_text:
Daxos's toughness is equal to your devotion to white. (Each {W} in the mana costs of permanents you control counts toward your devotion to white.)
Whenever another creature you control enters the battlefield or dies, you gain 1 life.
title: Daxos, Blessed by the Sun

name: Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite
oracle_text:
Vigilance
Other creatures you control get +2/+2.
Creatures your opponents control get -2/-2.
flavor_text: "Rejoice, blessed evangels! The glorious light of *compleation* is nigh. Soon, we shall awaken the Multiverse from its slumber."
title: Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite

name: Kenrith, the Returned King
oracle_text:
{R}: All creatures gain trample and haste until end of turn.
{1}{G}: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
{2}{W}: Target player gains 5 life.
{3}{U}: Target player draws a card.
{4}{B}: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under its owner's control.
title: Kenrith, the Returned King

name: Kwende, Pride of Femeref
oracle_text:
Double strike
Creatures you control with first strike have double strike.
flavor_text:
"His blades were the ultimate agents of transformation. All Phyrexians who met them were transformed into pieces."
—*Heroes of the Second Invasion*
title: Kwende, Pride of Femeref

name: Sram, Senior Edificer
oracle_text: Whenever you cast an Aura, Equipment, or Vehicle spell, draw a card.
flavor_text:
"Always have the right tool for the job, especially if the job is blasting Phyrexians in the face."
—Monument inscription
title: Sram, Senior Edificer

name: Thalia, Guardian of Thraben
oracle_text:
First strike
Noncreature spells cost {1} more to cast.
flavor_text: No stranger to monstrous foes, Thalia marshaled surviving cathars, townspeople, and even ghoulcallers into an unbreakable fighting force.
title: Thalia, Guardian of Thraben

name: Baral, Chief of Compliance
oracle_text:
Instant and sorcery spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
Whenever a spell or ability you control counters a spell, you may draw a card. If you do, discard a card.
flavor_text: In light of his zealous defense of Kaladesh, the Consulate was willing to overlook any previous transgressions.
title: Baral, Chief of Compliance

name: Emry, Lurker of the Loch
oracle_text:
This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.
When Emry, Lurker of the Loch enters the battlefield, mill four cards.
{T}: Choose target artifact card in your graveyard. You may cast that card this turn. (You still pay its costs. Timing rules still apply.)
title: Emry, Lurker of the Loch

name: Inga Rune-Eyes
oracle_text:
When Inga Rune-Eyes enters the battlefield, scry 3.
When Inga Rune-Eyes dies, draw three cards if three or more creatures died this turn.
flavor_text: Her fleet bore countless survivors to safety, slipping swiftly through strange currents no Phyrexian could track.
title: Inga Rune-Eyes

name: Jin-Gitaxias, Core Augur
oracle_text:
Flash
At the beginning of your end step, draw seven cards.
Each opponent's maximum hand size is reduced by seven.
flavor_text: His knowledge of the Multiverse enabled New Phyrexia to strike each plane with surgical precision.
title: Jin-Gitaxias, Core Augur

name: Tetsuko Umezawa, Fugitive
oracle_text: Creatures you control with power or toughness 1 or less can't be blocked.
flavor_text:
"Her talent for slipping unseen behind enemy lines provided information that would prove crucial to Dominaria's defense."
—*Heroes of the Second Invasion*
title: Tetsuko Umezawa, Fugitive

name: Ayara, First of Locthwain
oracle_text:
Whenever Ayara, First of Locthwain or another black creature enters the battlefield under your control, each opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
{T}, Sacrifice another black creature: Draw a card.
title: Ayara, First of Locthwain

name: Horobi, Death's Wail
oracle_text:
Flying
Whenever a creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, destroy that creature.
flavor_text:
"Wherever it went, death came to Phyrexians and Kamigawans alike."
—*Records of the Living Historians*
title: Horobi, Death's Wail

name: Seizan, Perverter of Truth
oracle_text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player loses 2 life and draws two cards.
flavor_text:
"In its hatred for the mortal realms, it fought on the side of the invaders, heedless of its own eventual fate."
—Records of the Living Historians
title: Seizan, Perverter of Truth

name: Sheoldred, Whispering One
oracle_text:
Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, that player sacrifices a creature.
title: Sheoldred, Whispering One

name: Skithiryx, the Blight Dragon
oracle_text:
Flying
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
{B}: Skithiryx, the Blight Dragon gains haste until end of turn.
{B}{B}: Regenerate Skithiryx.
title: Skithiryx, the Blight Dragon

name: Tymaret, Chosen from Death
oracle_text:
Tymaret's toughness is equal to your devotion to black. (Each {B} in the mana costs of permanents you control counts toward your devotion to black.)
{1}{B}: Exile up to two target cards from graveyards. You gain 1 life for each creature card exiled this way.
title: Tymaret, Chosen from Death

name: Yargle, Glutton of Urborg
flavor_text: Consuming even a single drop of the oil would spell doom for most living things. But Yargle was not most living things, and he ate enough to clean up most of Urborg.
title: Yargle, Glutton of Urborg

name: Captain Lannery Storm
oracle_text:
Haste
Whenever Captain Lannery Storm attacks, create a Treasure token. (It's an artifact with "{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color.")
Whenever you sacrifice a Treasure, Captain Lannery Storm gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
title: Captain Lannery Storm

name: Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer
oracle_text:
Whenever Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer deals combat damage to a player, create a Treasure token and exile the top card of that player's library. Until end of turn, you may cast that card.
Dash {1}{R} (You may cast this spell for its dash cost. If you do, it gains haste, and it's returned from the battlefield to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step.)
title: Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer

name: Squee, the Immortal
oracle_text: You may cast Squee, the Immortal from your graveyard or from exile.
flavor_text:
Squee had never wanted to be a king or a symbol of defiance against Phyrexians. Naturally, he found himself as both.
—*Heroes of the Second Invasion*
title: Squee, the Immortal

name: Urabrask the Hidden
oracle_text:
Creatures you control have haste.
Creatures your opponents control enter the battlefield tapped.
flavor_text: While the other praetors eagerly prepared for invasion, Urabrask retreated to the Furnace Layer, defying Elesh Norn's commands.
title: Urabrask the Hidden

name: Valduk, Keeper of the Flame
oracle_text: At the beginning of combat on your turn, for each Aura and Equipment attached to Valduk, Keeper of the Flame, create a 3/1 red Elemental creature token with trample and haste. Exile those tokens at the beginning of the next end step.
title: Valduk, Keeper of the Flame

name: Zada, Hedron Grinder
oracle_text: Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell that targets only Zada, Hedron Grinder, copy that spell for each other creature you control that the spell could target. Each copy targets a different one of those creatures.
flavor_text: To her delight, she was able to fully realize the explosive magical potential of hedrons.
title: Zada, Hedron Grinder

name: Fynn, the Fangbearer
oracle_text:
Deathtouch
Whenever a creature you control with deathtouch deals combat damage to a player, that player gets two poison counters. (A player with ten or more poison counters loses the game.)
flavor_text: "I always said I had a score to settle with that serpent. I'm a man of my word."
title: Fynn, the Fangbearer

name: Goreclaw, Terror of Qal Sisma
oracle_text:
Creature spells you cast with power 4 or greater cost {2} less to cast.
Whenever Goreclaw, Terror of Qal Sisma attacks, each creature you control with power 4 or greater gets +1/+1 and gains trample until end of turn.

name: Renata, Called to the Hunt
oracle_text:
Renata's power is equal to your devotion to green. (Each {G} in the mana costs of permanents you control counts toward your devotion to green.)
Each other creature you control enters the battlefield with an additional +1/+1 counter on it.

name: Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger
oracle_text:
Trample
Whenever you tap a land for mana, add one mana of any type that land produced.
Whenever an opponent taps a land for mana, that land doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
title: Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger

name: Yedora, Grave Gardener
oracle_text: Whenever another nontoken creature you control dies, you may return it to the battlefield face down under its owner's control. It's a Forest land. (It has no other types or abilities.)
flavor_text: She whispered ancient rites over the fallen, bidding their essences return to the land before they could be repurposed by the machines.
title: Yedora, Grave Gardener

name: Aegar, the Freezing Flame
oracle_text: Whenever a creature or planeswalker an opponent controls is dealt excess damage, if a Giant, Wizard, or spell you controlled dealt damage to it this turn, draw a card.
flavor_text: Though Phyrexian machines could adapt to extremes of heat or cold, they never figured out how to adapt to both at once.
title: Aegar, the Freezing Flame

name: Arixmethes, Slumbering Isle
oracle_text:
Arixmethes, Slumbering Isle enters the battlefield tapped with five slumber counters on it.
As long as Arixmethes has a slumber counter on it, it's a land. (It's not a creature.)
Whenever you cast a spell, you may remove a slumber counter from Arixmethes.
{T}: Add {G}{U}.
title: Arixmethes, Slumbering Isle

oracle_text:
Flying, vigilance, deathtouch, lifelink
At the beginning of your end step, proliferate. (Choose any number of permanents and/or players, then give each another counter of each kind already there.)

Menace

oracle_text:
Flying, vigilance, haste
Whenever Aurelia, the Warleader attacks for the first time each turn, untap all creatures you control. After this phase, there is an additional combat phase.

oracle_text:
Creature tokens you control have haste.

Whenever you gain life, each opponent loses 1 life.

oracle_text:
Flying, lifelink
Whenever you cast your second spell each turn, look at the top three cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.
